meanings.definition: To move with a splashing sound
meanings.sent1: The water will slosh as the boat moves.
meanings.sent2: I can hear the milk slosh in the jug.
meanings.sent3: Don't slosh your drink while dancing!
meanings.sent4: Her emotions slosh around inside her like a stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The rain sloshes against the window, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.sent1: The slosh of the waves was calming.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud slosh coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The slosh of the fountain made me want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The slosh of the waterfall echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The slosh of the mud under my boots signaled the start of the rainy season.

meanings.definition: To spill or splash liquid around
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to slosh the soup out of the bowl.
meanings.sent2: The kids accidentally sloshed paint on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to slosh water out of its bowl while playing.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing river sloshed over the banks.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter sloshed wine on the customer's shirt.

meanings.definition: A quantity of liquid that has been spilled or splashed around
meanings.sent1: There was a slosh of milk on the table.
meanings.sent2: The floor was wet from a slosh of water.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added a slosh of vinegar to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The bucket was heavy with a slosh of cleaning solution.
meanings.sent5: The garden hose sprayed a slosh of water onto the flowers.
